channel.title: Photo Catalog
channel.description: I am Raoul Pop, and this is my online photography catalog. The photos are organized into albums and sorted by location. You can search for specific photos by keywords as well. Contact me if you'd like to purchase a print or license a photo. Join me at raoulpop.com to read about the various places I've photographed.

item.title: Bar
item.description:
On one of Rome's narrow streets. This one was actually wider than most. Not sure where this is anymore.
In album Rome (Roma)

item.title: Houseboats on the Tiber
item.description:
Another view of the Tiber River in Rome, this one showing some of the many houseboats moored to the docks.
In album Rome (Roma)

item.title: That old Tiber
item.description:
One of the many bridges over the river Tiber in Rome.
In album Rome (Roma)

item.title: Nearer the truth
item.description:
The building in the background houses the famed Bocca della Verita. Would you dare to stick your hand fully inside it?
In album Rome (Roma)

item.title: Steps of stone and bars of iron
item.description:
An historic prison. If I have my facts straight, either the apostle Paul or Peter were kept here while in Rome.
In album Rome (Roma)

item.title: Basking in the sun
item.description:
Can't remember the name of this building. The clock on its tower says 2:12. It was early afternoon, and the sunlight was beautiful.
In album Rome (Roma)

item.title: Commerce
item.description:
Sellers peddling their wares from carts on wheels, in one of the piazzas of old Rome. The church in the background was undergoing renovations at the time.
In album Rome (Roma)

item.title: City walls
item.description:
One of the remnants of the original city walls built by the Romans. I'm still blown away by how sturdy and durable the Roman architecture was. It could stand the test of millenia. I can't say the same of modern architecture...
In album Rome (Roma)

item.title: Farnese
item.description:
This piazza is easy to tell, because its name is marked on the wall in the background. It's Piazza Farnese, a popular market for locals. My brother and I went there a couple of times while I was in Rome, to get groceries and such. To think, people have been coming there for centuries, if not millenia. March 1999, APS film.
In album Rome (Roma)

item.title: Bask in the sun
item.description:
One of the many statues of Rome, in one of its many piazzas. I should recall where this is, but I don't, sorry. March 1999, APS film.
In album Rome (Roma)

item.title: Walk at night
item.description:
Looking above one of the narrow streets of downtown Rome, from somewhere near Piazza di Spagna, at night. APS film, March 1999.
In album Rome (Roma)

item.title: Entrance to history
item.description:
Above the gate to the city by the Piazza dei Popoli, at night. The massive structure stands to this day, though it is clearly worn down by time.
In album Rome (Roma)

item.title: Arches and light spots
item.description:
APS film, March 1999. Light illuminates the antique tile floors of this church as it filters through its stained glass windows.
In album Rome (Roma)

item.title: Congregate
item.description:
APS film, March 1999. One of the piazzas, don't ask me which one. The people there were mostly tourists, I think I could count the locals in one breath.
In album Rome (Roma)

item.title: The cistern car
item.description:
APS film, winter of 1998. An old cistern car lay in the field, rusted and forgotten. It had either railroad wheels, or regular ones with the rubber worn off by time. There are many such relics in Romania, left wherever, mementos of times gone by.
In album On the Road (RO)

item.title: Hazy beauty
item.description:
APS film, winter of 1998. Somewhere on the side of a field. I loved how the sun's rays created a haze as they filtered through the branches of this tree. That light was beautiful.
In album On the Road (RO)

item.title: The empty road
item.description:
APS film, winter of 1998. The empty road. I'm outside a village somewhere, and the car that you can barely make out in this photo was my mode of conveyance during my travels that winter. It was a Dacia 1310, an automobile designed during Communist times. Its engine used technology from the 1960s, it didn't start when it was cold, still had a choke, an antique gear shifter, and poor brakes. But with some coddling, it managed to get me from point A to point B. Did I mention it had no AC, only a flap you'd close and open to let in heat from the engine?
In album On the Road (RO)

item.title: The orchard on the plateau
item.description:
APS film, winter of 1998. An orchard (don't ask me what kind) lays before me. A flat field extends in the background, and a few houses are barely visible, but one gets the feeling we're not in the low-lying fields, but on a plateau somewhere. You'd be right to think that. I believe I took this photo somewhere in Maramures, after I'd climbed up a twisty road for a considerable amount of time.
In album On the Road (RO)

item.title: A trip worth remembering
item.description:
APS film, winter of 1998. The slippery, somewhat icy road lies before me. Trees with their branches laden with snow line the roadside and the hillside that rises up on the right.
In album On the Road (RO)

item.title: Frosted hillside
item.description:
APS film, winter of 1998. The slopes of two hills rise before me, one covered with little snow, the other buried in it. Frost coveres the branches of the trees, rendering them white.
In album On the Road (RO)

item.title: Winter landscape
item.description:
APS film, winter of 1998. A vast valley lays before me, all covered in snow, with forests here and there, some of evergreens, some devoid of leaves. Fog and haze make the outlines of distance hills and mountains barely visible. A village is nestled between the hills in the background.
In album On the Road (RO)

item.title: Smoke plumes rise heavenward
item.description:
APS film, winter of 1998. A sleepy village nestled at the base of a hill covered with snow-laden evergreens.
In album On the Road (RO)

item.title: Snowstorm
item.description:
During one of those nice Vermont winters. APS film.
In album Middlebury (VT)

item.title: Sports field
item.description:
This was behind the Gym. There was a cross-country ski path (lighted in winter) that started somewhere around here.
In album Middlebury (VT)

item.title: Chateau
item.description:
The Chateau on a sunny autumn afternoon. French classes and (I believe) other foreign language classes were held there. There was a tiny dining room in the basement where I'd get breakfast sometimes. APS film.
In album Middlebury (VT)

item.title: Gently up the hill
item.description:
One of my favorite photos from the college years. This is the path up the hill from Monroe Hall, the English building, which is outside the photo, toward the left.
In album Middlebury (VT)

item.title: On the way to dinner
item.description:
Sometime on a fall evening. APS film. I think I was on my way to dinner after a workout at the gym.
In album Middlebury (VT)

item.title: Chateau and Battell Field
item.description:
On a beautiful autumn day. The Vermont mountains are visible in the background. APS film.
In album Middlebury (VT)

item.title: Rays of light
item.description:
Sunshine breaks through a thick cloud cover. APS film. Have no idea when I took this photo, so the IPTC date is arbitrary.
In album Middlebury (VT)

item.title: Starr Library in the fall
item.description:
APS film, sometime in the fall of 1996 or 1997. Starr Library is in the background, before the renovations.
In album Middlebury (VT)

item.title: Old Chapel through fall foliage
item.description:
APS film. Either autumn 1996 or 1997. Old Chapel is visible in the background, through the branches of the trees.
In album Middlebury (VT)

item.title: Old Chapel through fall foliage II
item.description:
APS film. Another view of Old Chapel in the fall, with student cars perenially lining the streets of the college.
In album Middlebury (VT)

item.title: Fall foliage down Main Street
item.description:
APS film. Looking down Main Street during the fall of 1996 or 1997. The town of Middlebury is down in the valley, barely visible in the background, mid-right.
In album Middlebury (VT)

item.title: Rainy fall day
item.description:
APS film. Don't know when I took this, but it's possible it was in September or October of 1997. I don't even remember the location, but I think I'm facing Battell Field from the side of one of the buildings. I could be wrong though, it could be toward McCullough.
In album Middlebury (VT)

item.title: Pine trees laden with snow
item.description:
Winter 1998, APS film. Decent winter, but nothing like the one we had in 1994-1995.
In album Middlebury (VT)

item.title: Have a seat, won't you?
item.description:
January 1995, APS film. Almost waist-high snow at times. Those were beautiful winters. I haven't seen that much snow since then.
In album Middlebury (VT)

item.title: During a snowstorm
item.description:
January 1995, APS film. A typical Vermont winter during my college years.
In album Middlebury (VT)

item.title: Remains of the day
item.description:
Taken with my Canon Elph on APS film sometime in 1997 or 1998. Sunlight had just broken through a dark cloud cover, revealing these wonderful colors. This is on the campus of Middlebury College.
In album Middlebury (VT)

item.title: Dusk on the hill
item.description:
Taken with my Canon Elph on APS film in May, 1998, on the campus of my alma mater, Middlebury College.
In album Middlebury (VT)

item.title: After the rain
item.description:
Taken with my Canon Elph on APS film sometime in 1997. Sunlight had just broken through a dark cloud cover, revealing these wonderful colors. This is on the campus of Middlebury College.
In album Middlebury (VT)

item.title: Walking under the dusk sky
item.description:
Taken with my Canon Elph on APS film in May, 1998, on the campus of my alma mater, Middlebury College.
In album Middlebury (VT)

item.title: Pigeons on wires
item.description:
Taken in 1996 on APS film. Title is self-explanatory. In Hollywood, FL.
In album Hollywood (FL)

item.title: Intracostal Waterway
item.description:
Taken sometime in 1997 on APS film. Close to the intersection of Diplomat Parkway with Atlantic Shores Boulevard in Hallandale Beach.
In album Hallandale Beach (FL)

item.title: Seagull takes flight
item.description:
A seagull hurries to join its companions.
In album Constanta

item.title: The wharf and Black Sea
item.description:
I'm standing at the base of the circular rocky wharf which extends into the background of this photo. The sea is calm. A freight ship is visible in the distance. If you look carefully, you can spot a seagull flying directly above the ship.
In album Constanta

item.title: Inland from the beach
item.description:
A view of the apartment buildings on the beach at the point where the coast turns inland once more. It's quite windy out there in winter.
In album Constanta

item.title: The wharf in winter
item.description:
It looks deserted here, albeit a couple of people are braving the cold. The sea is calm, though you can see the small waves caused by the breeze that blows inland.
In album Constanta

item.title: Tariverde 2 km
item.description:
On the road, close to the village of Tariverde, in Dobrogea. The sun is setting over the flat Dobrogea fields.
In album On the Road (RO)

item.title: Reeds on frozen lake
item.description:
A large lake near the city of Babadag, in Dobrogea, Romania.
In album On the Road (RO)
